function_reachability: Is there a call path from function 'main' to function 'printf'?
Is it impossible for function 'printf' to reach function 'main'?
loop_reachability: Can the loop with condition 'i < SIZE' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'i < SIZE' always executed?
Can the loop with condition 'j < SIZE' be skipped entirely?
Is the loop with condition 'j < SIZE' always executed?
dominators: Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'i < SIZE' without passing through its header block?
Is there at least one path that reaches the body of the loop with condition 'j < SIZE' without passing through its header block?
data_dependency: Does the value assigned to 'i (line 5)' affect subsequent computations?
Is variable 'j (line 5)' used after its definition?
liveness: Is variable 'i' live at the end of function 'main'?
Is variable 'sum' live at the end of function 'main'?
dead_code: Can the statement 'for(k = 0;k < SIZE;k++)' be considered dead code?
Is this statement not dead: “int i,j,k;”?
